alert.note: Alert for Coastal Miami Dade County; Far South Miami-Dade County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Mainland Monroe; Metropolitan Miami Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 21 at 9:45AM EST by NWS Miami
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Mainland Monroe and Miami-Dade Counties through 1030 AM EST... At 945 AM EST, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a funnel cloud along a line extending from near Fortymile Bend to near Shark Valley Obs Tower to near Flamingo. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Homestead, Homestead General Airport, The Redland, Flamingo, Doral, Florida City, Naranja, Richmond West, Country Walk, Kendale Lakes, Leisure City, Pennsuco, Everglades National Park, The Hammocks, Royal Palm Ranger, Shark Valley Obs Tower, West Kendall, Intersection Krome And Kendall Drive, Mahogany Hammock and Miccosukee Resort. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. This activity was also developing in an environment favorable for the formation of funnel clouds. Stay tuned to NOAA weather radio and local media for additional updates and possible warnings.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Miami Dade County; Far South Miami-Dade County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Mainland Monroe; Metropolitan Miami Dade
